recipe.name: Sablés salés
recipe.subname: A savoury version of the sablé spritz
recipe.notes: You will need a piping bag or tool. If you are using De Guyer's "Le Tube" with a biscuit attachment, set it to 2cl output.
recipe.attribution: Liberally adapted from the sweet version.

listInstructions.instruction: Warm the oven to 180°C. Alternatively, you can do this latter, leaving your biscuits for a bit longer in the fridge.
Whip together the margarine and half the yeast flakes until creamy.
Add the milk little by little. Ideally it should form a consistent mixture, but it doesn't matter too much if not.
In another bowl, mix the rest of the yeast flakes, flour, cornstarch and salt.
Fold together the two mixtures, avoiding mixing too much so as to not develop the gluten.

Use a piping bag with a fluted nozzle to create the iconic spritz zig-zag shape directly onto a baking sheet covered with grease proof paper or a silicon sheet. Alternatively, you can use a special biscuit press to stamp out your biscuits. There are lots of options here.
Put the biscuits in the fridge for at least 5 minutes, preferably 15 minutes, probably no more than 30 minutes. This will help maintain their shape.
Transfer the biscuits to the oven and bake for 15-20 minutes.
